etymologies: Old English lēac, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch look and German Lauch

definitions: a plant related to the onion, with flat overlapping leaves forming an elongated cylindrical bulb which together with the leaf bases is eaten as a vegetable. It is used as a Welsh national emblem.
shortDefinitions: plant related to onion, with flat overlapping leaves forming elongated cylindrical bulb which together with leaf bases is eaten as vegetable
